frevo.method.randomsearch

Class RandomSearch

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.AbstractComponent
      • core.AbstractMethod
        • frevo.method.randomsearch.RandomSearch

  • public class RandomSearch
extends AbstractMethod
    Evolutionary method which uses random generation of new members to find the most adapted to current problem. This method is very simple so it is better not to use in the experiments as the primary method.
    Author:
    Sergii Zhevzhyk

      • loadFromXML

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<AbstractRepresentation>> loadFromXML(org.dom4j.Document doc)
        Description copied from class: AbstractMethod
        Load representations from a results XML doc object. The representations are arranged as a list of populations where each population is represented as a list of representations (or solutions).

        If the loading takes considerable amount of time it is advised to provide visual feedback to the user. This can be done by calling the FrevoMain.setLoadingProgress(float) method.

        Specified by:
        loadFromXML in class AbstractMethod
        Parameters:
        doc - The source Document to be used for loading the representations.
        Returns:
        A 2D array of AbstractRepresentations loaded from the source document.

      • evolve

        private boolean evolve(RanEvoStep step)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Evolve population by one generation
        Parameters:
        step - contains information about current step and some global variables for execution of an experiment
        Returns:
        true if evolution has been finished successfully, false - otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - error has been occurred during evolution process
